articles.description: Heavyweight Anthony Joshua spectacularly knocks out Robert Helenius with one punch in round seven, after boxing tentatively in the first half of the fight at London's O2 Arena.
articles.title: Joshua knocks out Helenius in seventh round

articles.description: England have answered every challenge at the Women's World Cup, but it will be nothing compared to a semi-final against Australia, writes Emma Sanders.
articles.title: 'England battle on but toughest test awaits'

articles.description: England captain Harry Kane makes his Bayern Munich debut only hours after completing an £86m move from Tottenham.
articles.title: Kane makes Bayern debut in 3-0 Super Cup defeat

articles.description: England captain Owen Farrell could miss their World Cup opener against Argentina after being sent off in their warm-up win over Wales at Twickenham.
articles.title: England beat Wales but Farrell could miss World Cup start

articles.description: The Magpies were in stellar form as they ripped into a lacklustre Villa side on the opening weekend.
articles.title: Howe says fans 'should dream' after 'perfect day'

articles.description: Charley Hull is the joint leader of the Women's Open with American Lilia Vu heading into the final round at Walton Heath on Sunday.
articles.title: Hull tied for lead going into Open final round

articles.description: Watch highlights as England progress to the Women's World Cup semi-finals, where they will face co-hosts Australia, after coming from behind to beat Colombia 2-1 in Sydney.
articles.title: England beat Colombia to set up Australia semi-final

articles.description: France score a late penalty to avenge last weekend's defeat by Scotland, who run in four tries in Saint Etienne.
articles.title: Gallant Scotland fall to late penalty in France

articles.description: Leigh Leopards win their first Challenge Cup title for 52 years after they edge out a valiant Hull KR in a thriller at Wembley.
articles.title: Leigh beat Hull KR in epic Challenge Cup final

articles.description: Southern Brave's Tymal Mills becomes the first male player in this year's Hundred to take a hat-trick to inspire a comfortable victory over Welsh Fire.
articles.title: Mills hat-trick inspires Southern Brave to easy victory
